intro: Actinea acaulis f. arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona barrenstem actinia, is a rare variant of the barrenstem actinia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae, characterized by its lack of leaves and a short, sturdy stem. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to arid environments and is found primarily in the southwestern United States. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
